One Sample Test of Proportion

infer_os_prop_test compares proportion in one group to a specified population proportion.

infer_os_prop_test(n, prob = 0.5, alternative = c("both", "less", "greater",
  "all"), ...)

# S3 method for default
infer_os_prop_test(n, prob = 0.5, alternative = c("both",
  "less", "greater", "all"), phat, ...)

# S3 method for factor
infer_os_prop_test(n, prob = 0.5, alternative = c("both",
  "less", "greater", "all"), ...)

Arguments

n
number of observations
prob
hypothesised proportion
alternative
a character string specifying the alternative hypothesis, must be one of "both" (default), "greater", "less" or "all". You can specify just the initial letter.
...
other arguments
phat
observed proportion

Value

infer_os_prop_test returns an object of class "infer_os_prop_test". An object of class "infer_os_prop_test" is a list containing the following components:

Deprecated Function

prop_test() has been deprecated. Instead use infer_os_prop_test().

References

Sheskin, D. J. 2007. Handbook of Parametric and Nonparametric Statistical Procedures, 4th edition. : Chapman & Hall/CRC.

See also

prop.test binom.test

Examples

# use as a calculator
infer_os_prop_test(200, prob = 0.5, phat = 0.3)
#>      Test Statistics       
#> --------------------------
#> Sample Size            200 
#> Exp Prop               0.5 
#> Obs Prop               0.3 
#> z                  -5.6569 
#> Pr(|Z| > |z|)            0 
#> 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#> Category    Observed    Expected    % Deviation    Std. Residuals 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#>    0          140         100          40.00            4.00      
#>    1           60         100         -40.00           -4.00      
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------

# using data set
infer_os_prop_test(as.factor(hsb$female), prob = 0.5)
#>      Test Statistics      
#> -------------------------
#> Sample Size           200 
#> Exp Prop              0.5 
#> Obs Prop            0.545 
#> z                  1.2728 
#> Pr(|Z| > |z|)      0.2031 
#> 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#> Category    Observed    Expected    % Deviation    Std. Residuals 
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
#>    0           91         100          -9.00           -0.90      
#>    1          109         100           9.00            0.90      
#> -----------------------------------------------------------------
